current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize early repayment of obligations to the Bureau of Reclamation within the Northport
			 Irrigation District in the State of Nebraska.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

quote.#tail:
) may repay, at any time, the construction costs of project facilities allocated to the land  of
			 the landowner within the district.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, any landowner
			 within the Northport Irrigation District in the State of Nebraska
			 (referred to in this section as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 213 of the Reclamation Reform Act of 1982

text.#text:
On discharge, in full, of the obligation for repayment of the construction costs that are allocated
			 to all land of the landowner in the district, the land shall not be
			 subject to the ownership and full-cost pricing limitations under the
			 reclamation laws.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide to the landowner a
			 certificate described in

text.#text: On request of a landowner that has repaid, in full, the construction costs described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 213(b)(1) of the Reclamation Reform Act
			 of 1982

text.#text:
modifies any contractual rights under, or amends or reopens, the reclamation contract between the
			 district and the United States; or

modifies any rights, obligations, or relationships between the district and landowners in the
			 district under Nebraska State law.
